trashday.model

Class DateTimeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • trashday.model.DateTimeUtils

  • public class DateTimeUtils
extends Object
    Helper functions that address gaps and inconsistencies among the various date/time components in early Java, ical4j's work-arounds, and Java 8.
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin
    See Also:
    iCal4j Readme: ical4j and Timezones, Java SE 8 Date and Time

    • Method Detail

      • getLocalDateTime

        public static LocalDateTime getLocalDateTime(Date datetime,
                                             TimeZone timeZone)
        Find a LocalDateTime for the given user Date and TimeZone.
        Parameters:
        datetime - Date source
        timeZone - TimeZone source
        Returns:
        LocalDateTime corresponding to given datetime and timeZone

      • getMinuteOfDay

        public static int getMinuteOfDay(LocalDateTime ldt)
        Get the minute of the day for a given LocalDateTime. For example, 1:05 AM = 60+5 = 65, 2:10 AM = 120 + 10 = 130, etc. Provides an easy way to sort LocalDateTime objects based on time-of-day, but independent of which day they occur.
        Parameters:
        ldt - LocalDateTime source
        Returns:
        minute-of-day for given LocalDateTime

      • getDayOfWeek

        public static DayOfWeek getDayOfWeek(WeekDay wd)
        Convert from an ical4j WeekDay to a Java 8 DayOfWeek.
        Parameters:
        wd - ical4j weekday source
        Returns:
        DayOfWeek value

      • getWeekDay

        public static WeekDay getWeekDay(DayOfWeek dow,
                                 Integer weekNum)
        Convert from Java 8 DayOfWeek with a given week-of-month offset into the ical4j WeekDay.
        Parameters:
        dow - DayOfWeek source
        weekNum - Integer for week-of-month turns into the WeekDay offset.
        Returns:
        WeekDay

      • getNextOrSameDayOfMonth

        public static LocalDateTime getNextOrSameDayOfMonth(LocalDateTime ldtBase,
                                                    Integer dom,
                                                    LocalTime tod)
        Find the time a given day-of-month occurs.

        Would really like an easy Java 8 TemporalAdjuster. (See link below.) But this functions serves the purpose for now.

        Parameters:
        ldtBase - Check for occurrences at this date/time or later.
        dom - day-of-month to find. May be [1,31] or [-31,-1].
        tod - LocalTime time-of-day to set in result.
        Returns:
        LocalDateTime of the first time the given dom and tod occur on-or-after the given ldtBase.
        See Also:
        Java 8 TemporalAdjusters.nextOrSame

      • getNextOrSameWeekdayOfMonth

        public static LocalDateTime getNextOrSameWeekdayOfMonth(LocalDateTime ldtBase,
                                                        DayOfWeek dow,
                                                        Integer weekNum,
                                                        LocalTime tod)
        Find the time a given weekday-of-month occurs. For example, 2nd Sunday, 1st Friday, etc.

        Would really like an easy Java 8 TemporalAdjuster. (See link below.) But this functions serves the purpose for now.

        Parameters:
        ldtBase - Check for occurrences at this date/time or later.
        dow - day-of-week to find..
        weekNum - Recur every Nth dow in the month. Allowed values [1,5] and [-5,-1]
        tod - LocalTime time-of-day to set in result.
        Returns:
        LocalDateTime of the first time the given dow+weekNum occur on-or-after the given ldtBase.
        See Also:
        Java 8 TemporalAdjusters.nextOrSame
